text: Marie-Claire Kirkland-Casgrain (September 8, 1924 â€“ March 24, 2016) was a Canadian lawyer, judge and politician. She was the first woman elected to the Legislative Assembly of Quebec. She was the first woman appointed a Cabinet minister in Quebec, the first woman appointed acting premier, and the first woman judge to serve in the Quebec Provincial Court. On March 24, 2016, she died at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1924 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian judges Category:Politicians from Quebec Category:Politicians from Massachusetts
title: Marie-Claire Kirkland
